Description: Gold amulet of irregular oblong form, with a loop at the back for suspension; decorated with engraved designs: above, the heads of Shu and Tefnut, the former shown as a man's head wearing feathers and the latter by the head of a lioness wearing a sun disc and uraeus; in the middle, Sakhmet holding an ankh and sceptre; below, a fish.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (1254)
